Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2008 10:16AM heatherof5 wrote: hi there i am new here and had the same procedure with the wire (you would think they could come up with something better considering we can put a man on the moon) anyway....i had about a five inch scare and the results were b9 and that was two years ago and now i am having another biospy in office next week on the same side.  i wish you the best.  i am now considering a profylactic mast. or genetic testing considering heavy family history.  if anyone has info on these procedures please let me know.  i need help with this decision.
Posts.Title: Biopsy done yesterday sbd jme

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2008 05:28AM heatherof5 wrote: hi there,  i am fairly new here, and i am 31 and facing the same uncertainty as you mention.  I have RA and had a biopsy which led to a lumpectomy yesterday.   I am doing the worrying and naturally it is over a weekend.  The results will be in hopefully Tuesday for my follow up appt.  and I have 3 little ones at home.  I had the hysterectomy at 29 and thought the worst was behind me.  The ladies here are wonderful and I wish you the very best and please feel free to send me a message if you just want to vent)  heather
